pageContext.claim: “We've appointed many judges to the 9th Circuit because President Obama foolishly left me one hundred and forty two judges. It's impossible to believe. I thought he'd have, you know, leave us none. He left us one hundred and forty two and since then, we've approved a lot more than that, a lot more than added on to that.”
pageContext.analysis: There were 88 district and 17 court of appeals vacancies when Trump took office, so a total of 105 -- not through Obama's lack of effort. Senate Republicans refused to move on his nominations.
